data.title: Aave Proposal Advances to Next Stage in Token-Centric Transformation
data.description: Aave founder Stani Kulechov has announced the successful passage of the 'Aave Will Win' proposal through the Temp Check stage. According to NS3.AI, this proposal seeks to transition Aave Labs into a fully token-centric ecosystem, with all product revenue directed towards the AAVE token. The upcoming phase will involve refining the proposal structure based on community feedback before advancing to the ARFC stage.

data.title: BTCS executive: Crypto treasury companies may see a wave of consolidation in 2026.
data.description: Wojciech Kaszycki, Chief Strategy Officer of BTCS, stated that consolidation may occur among crypto treasury companies in 2026 amidst a continued market downturn. He pointed out that some companies are currently trading at a discount, with their share prices below the net asset value (NAV) of their crypto assets. Kaszycki believes that companies with actual operational businesses (such as blockchain validator services or public/private lending products) have better cash flow and are better positioned to acquire companies that only hold crypto assets but lack operating revenue. Furthermore, he mentioned that the tokenization of real-world assets (RWA), especially the on-chaining of public and private lending assets, may see significant growth in the next 24 months and could become a potential revenue source for treasury companies. He also mentioned that Strategy, the world's largest Bitcoin treasury company, offers investors credit-like and fixed-income instruments, using this as a key argument for inclusion in the MSCI index. (Cointelegraph)

data.title: OpenAI's Safety Approach Influences U.S. War Department Collaboration
data.description: OpenAI founder Sam Altman recently addressed the company's collaboration with the U.S. War Department. According to NS3.AI, the discussions highlighted a significant difference in approach between OpenAI and Anthropic, another AI company that was close to securing an agreement with the Department. The divergence stemmed from Anthropic's preference for explicit operational control through contract clauses, contrasting with OpenAI's focus on layered technical safety measures and legal frameworks. This emphasis on safety technology over restrictive contractual clauses may have played a role in the Department's decision to collaborate with OpenAI.

data.title: U.S. Military Utilizes AI Technology in Middle East Strikes Amid New Ban
data.description: The United States conducted airstrikes in the Middle East using artificial intelligence technology developed by Anthropic. According to Jin10, these operations occurred just hours after U.S. President Donald Trump announced a ban on Anthropic. The decision to employ AI in military actions highlights the ongoing integration of advanced technologies in defense strategies, despite recent regulatory measures. The timing of the strikes, in conjunction with the new restrictions, underscores the complex relationship between technological innovation and policy enforcement in the U.S. defense sector.

data.title: Strategy Founder Michael Saylor Announces Dividend Rate Increase
data.description: Strategy founder Michael Saylor announced on social media that the dividend rate for STRC, maturing in March 2026, has been increased by 25 basis points to 11.50%. According to ChainCatcher, this adjustment reflects the company's strategic financial decisions.

data.title: Associated Press: US lawmakers plan to push for a war powers resolution to limit action against Iraq.
data.description: Key members of the U.S. Congress are calling for a swift vote on a war powers resolution to limit Trump's military action against Iran. These lawmakers stated that current actions may be controversial in terms of legitimacy and expressed concern that the U.S. could be drawn into a larger-scale conflict in the Middle East. (Associated Press)

data.title: The Burj Al Arab hotel in Dubai was attacked and caught fire; the fire has been extinguished.
data.description: At approximately 1:30 AM local time on March 1st, an attack and fire occurred on the northeast side of the Burj Al Arab hotel in Dubai. Some tourists were resting at the time and were awakened by the explosion and tremors. They were subsequently evacuated via emergency exits. Thick smoke initially filled the hotel lobby. The fire has now been extinguished. Some foreign media outlets have reported that the incident may have been caused by a drone attack; further details are still pending confirmation. (CCTV)

data.title: GEOPOLITICS | Canada Condemns Iran's Attack on Qatar
data.description: Canada's Foreign Minister Anita Anand has issued a strong condemnation of Iran's recent attack on Qatar. According to Jin10, Canada stands in solidarity with Qatar and all its regional partners to ensure security and prevent any further escalation.

data.title: Arthur Hayes posted an article signaling a bullish outlook on HYPE, stating that the target price could reach $150.
data.description: BitMEX co-founder Arthur Hayes posted on the X platform that while traditional exchanges (TradExchanges) were closed over the weekend, the decentralized derivatives platform Hyperliquid "remained open as usual," becoming a place where price discovery took place. He stated bluntly, "Price discovery happens here when traditional exchanges are asleep." Arthur Hayes also announced a target price of $150 for the platform's token HYPE, releasing a strong bullish signal.

data.title: Sam Altman responds to the US War Department's choice of OpenAI over Anthropic: Disagreements may stem from demands for operational control.
data.description: In an AMA on the X platform, OpenAI founder Sam Altman responded to the recent collaboration with the U.S. Department of War. He disclosed that Anthropic and the U.S. Department of War were once "very close to reaching an agreement," and both sides had a strong desire to cooperate for most of the negotiations. However, the highly tense negotiation environment could quickly deteriorate, which may be one of the important reasons why the deal ultimately failed to materialize. In terms of security philosophy, OpenAI adopts a "layered approach," which includes building a security technology stack, deploying Frontier Deployment Engineers (FDEs), involving security researchers in the project, delivering through cloud deployment, and cooperating directly with the U.S. Department of War. Compared to setting specific prohibitions in the contract, Anthropic seems to focus more on explicit restrictions at the contractual level, while OpenAI tends to rely more on the applicable legal framework and use technical security protection measures as the core guarantee. However, other companies may have different positions on this. Anthropic may hope to gain more operational control in the collaboration, which may also be one of the reasons for the divergence in their approaches.

data.title: Solana Foundation President Clarifies Stance on Cryptocurrency Involvement
data.description: Lily Liu, President of the Solana Foundation, recently addressed criticism following her previous remark that people should 'not waste time on cryptocurrency.' According to NS3.AI, Liu clarified her position by emphasizing her focus on developing projects rather than engaging in crypto asset trading. Her initial comment had led to community backlash and speculation regarding her role and involvement in the cryptocurrency market.

data.title: U.S. President Trump Comments on Iranian Leadership Prospects
data.description: U.S. President Donald Trump stated on Saturday that following the announcement of the death of Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, there are 'some excellent candidates' who could lead Iran. According to Jin10, during a phone interview with CBS News, Trump was asked about who he believes is in charge. He responded, 'I know very well who it is, but I can't tell you.' When questioned if he prefers a particular Iranian leader to take charge, Trump replied, 'Yes, I think so. There are some good candidates.' Trump did not elaborate further on whom he was referring to.

data.title: Bitcoin steadies as Iran denies Khamenei death reports
data.description:
Bitcoin steadies as markets assess U. S. -Israeli strikes on Iran and conflicting claims; Iran denies Khamenei death. Focus on macro risk and succession.
source: https://coincu.com/news/bitcoin-steadies-as-iran-denies-khamenei-death-reports/

data.title: Michael Saylor: STRC's deferred dividend yield will be increased to 11.50% in March 2026.
data.description: Michael Saylor posted on social media that the STRC deferred dividend yield, which expires in March 2026, has been increased by 25 basis points to 11.50%.

data.title: Lily Liu responded to controversial remarks, seemingly implying that she "doesn't speculate on cryptocurrencies, she only focuses on infrastructure development."
data.description: Solana Foundation President Lily Liu posted a screenshot on Twitter of her controversial previous statement about "not wasting time on cryptocurrencies," along with the caption, "I don't eat pasta, but I love making it." The community speculates that Liu's response suggests she's not involved in cryptocurrency trading, but rather focused on infrastructure development. Previously, Liu had jokingly echoed OpenClaw founder Peter Steinberger's statement about "not wasting time on cryptocurrencies," which drew strong criticism from the community.

data.title: Australian Prime Minister Reaffirms Stance Against Iranian Regime
data.description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has reiterated the country's firm opposition to the Iranian regime. According to Jin10, Albanese emphasized Australia's clear stance against what he described as the 'brutal' Iranian government. This statement underscores Australia's ongoing diplomatic position and aligns with its broader foreign policy objectives. The Prime Minister's remarks come amid heightened international scrutiny of Iran's domestic and foreign policies.

data.title: GEOPOLITICS | Cuba Calls for End to U.S. and Israeli Aggression Against Iran
data.description: Cuba's Ministry of Foreign Affairs has issued a statement urging the cessation of recent aggressive actions by the United States and Israel towards Iran. According to Jin10, the Cuban government expressed its concern over the escalating tensions and called for diplomatic solutions to resolve the conflict. The statement highlights the importance of maintaining peace and stability in the region, emphasizing the need for dialogue and negotiation. Cuba's position reflects its longstanding opposition to foreign intervention and its support for sovereignty and self-determination.

data.title: Iran's crypto ecosystem is projected to reach $7.78 billion by 2025, with the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps controlling over 50% of the funds.
data.description: Chainalysis data shows that Iran's crypto ecosystem reached $7.78 billion in 2025, with addresses associated with the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) accounting for over 50% of the crypto fund inflows, receiving over $3 billion throughout the year. Elliptic points out that the Central Bank of Iran received at least $507 million in USDT in 2025 for stabilizing the rial and trade settlements. The Iranian government's Bitcoin mining cost is approximately $1,300 per coin, which is sold at market price. Recent US-Israeli military strikes against Iran may disrupt the power grid, thereby affecting energy-intensive mining activities. (CoinDesk)

data.title: France's February New Car Registrations Drop 14.7% Amid Tesla's Surge
data.description: New car registrations in France fell by 14.7% in February, totaling 120,764 vehicles. According to Jin10, this decline contrasts with the performance of Tesla, which saw its registrations increase by 55.11% during the same period. The overall decrease in new car registrations highlights challenges in the automotive market, while Tesla's growth indicates a rising interest in electric vehicles.

data.title: Aave Will Win's proposal Temp Check has been approved.
data.description: Aave founder Stani Kulechov announced on the X platform that the Aave Will Win proposal's Temp Check has been approved, which will drive Aave Labs' transformation to a fully token-centric model, allocating 100% of product revenue to AAVE tokens. The next step will be to optimize the structure based on community feedback and enter the ARFC phase.
